info.headline: Severe Weather Statement issued April 01 at 1:31PM EDT until April 01 at 1:45PM EDT by NWS Pittsburgh
info.description: ...A SEVERE THUNDERSTORM WARNING REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 145 PM EDT FOR MERCER...BEAVER...LAWRENCE AND BROOKE COUNTIES... At 131 PM EDT, severe thunderstorms were located along a line extending from Andover to near New Cumberland, moving northeast at 65 mph. HAZARD...60 mph wind gusts. SOURCE...Radar indicated. IMPACT...Expect damage to trees and power lines, resulting in some power outages. Locations impacted include... New Castle, Weirton, Steubenville, Hermitage, Sharon, Aliquippa, Beaver Falls, Monaca, Sharpsville, Economy, Ellwood City, and Ambridge. HAIL THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX HAIL SIZE...<.75 IN WIND THREAT...RADAR INDICATED MAX WIND GUST...60 MPH
info.instruction: For your protection move to an interior room on the lowest floor of a building. Please report severe weather by calling 412-262-1988, posting to the NWS Pittsburgh Facebook page, or using Twitter @NWSPITTSBURGH.
